title: Weather Radar
alt: Ever notice how there aren't as many thunderstorms now as there were when you were a kid? Much like 'the shuffle on my MP3 player has a bias', this is occasionally true but universally believed. Brains are so interesting!
transcript:
[A black dot on a pixelated weather radar screen.]
Sigh. Just a few clouds.[The clouds develop into orange, to the left of the dot.]
Whoa! Huge storm out of nowhere![The orange becomes red, and the storm moves towards the dot.]
It's growing! And headed right for me! Awesome![The storm splits in half.]
Hey! What's it...[The two halves of the storm pass by the dot.]
Dammit! Again?!When the folks at the weather offices see you refreshing the radar too often, they start teasing you.
